meanings.definition: Pleasantly salty or spicy in taste
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a savory stew for dinner.
meanings.sent2: I love the savory flavor of the grilled chicken.
meanings.sent3: The savory aroma of the spices filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her savory cooking always delighted the guests.
meanings.sent5: The savory taste of the soup lingered on my tongue.

meanings.definition: An aromatic herb used in cooking
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a pinch of savory.
meanings.sent2: She added savory to enhance the dish's flavor.
meanings.sent3: The savory herb gave the sauce a delightful kick.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with the fragrance of savory.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully selected the freshest savory for the dish.

meanings.definition: A dish that is not sweet, typically served as a main course
meanings.sent1: The savory pie was a hit at the potluck.
meanings.sent2: I prefer savory dishes over sweet desserts.
meanings.sent3: The savory lasagna made everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant's specialty was a savory roast beef.
meanings.sent5: The savory aroma from the kitchen made my stomach growl.

meanings.sent1: She was known for her savory character and honesty.
meanings.sent2: The community admired his savory deeds.
meanings.sent3: His savory actions always inspired others to do good.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's savory nature made her a role model.
meanings.sent5: His savory reputation preceded him wherever he went.
